TopicTitle: Progress And Soyuz Rocket Replica Now With Better Boosters!

Articles.Content:
The Soyuz rocket is a member of the R7 rocket family. Other R7 rocket include Sputnik Vostok Molniya and Polyot. Progress is used to resupply space stations.

Soyuz

![Gj45SlX.png](http://i.imgur.com/Gj45SlX.png)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-06T13:14:32Z" title="06/06/2015 01:14  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 6, 2015</time> by Lime**
Why are the boosters so small? They should be half to two thirds the size of the rocket. Other than that, the rocket looks good

I tried to that but then the booster colided with the second stage. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

- - - Updated - - -

Also is there anything else that looks weird?

> 
> Also is there anything else that looks weird?

uhm pretty much the whole lower part of the rocket. 

Especially the part where the diameter is actually smaller wich isn't in the real soyuz.
The second stage or the core is smaller than the third stage. ![:rolleyes:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_rolleyes.gif)

> 
> uhm pretty much the whole lower part of the rocket. 
> Especially the part where the diameter is actually smaller wich isn't in the real soyuz.

erm, the lower part of the core stage is 2,05m in diameter on the real thing ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) while the boosters largest diameter (at the bottom) have a 2.680m diameter ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

on the other end, the core stage top diameter is 2.57m, and it's widest point (just above the pointy end of the boosters) is 2.95m in diameter ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

The core of the rocket is awesome dude. Very well done. the outer boosters could be improved a bit. They need to be much longer and more shapely.

 Is the cargo pilot-able?

Yes it is the Progress includes Battman batteries and a probe core. I can try to make the boosters look better.

- - - Updated - - -

Okay i made the boosters more shaply. What do you think?
Make the soyuz and progress 1.25 m and this would be a great replica
How should i make the core stage. It needs to be smaller than 1.25 m to be in scale. ![:rolleyes:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_rolleyes.gif)

I clicked "worst ever" just because I felt like as long as the option was there, someone had to pick it xD

Really I think it looks fine. I like how it's a bit "stubby" and thus more "Kerbal-looking".

Looks a lot better! 

BTW why fins? I searched for the proton M and Soyuz on Google but no rocket had them. 

A engine cluster with thrust vectoring engines should provide enough stability right?
The Soyuz boosters B V G D have small fins.
Oh yes I see, very small ones tough ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
